text: "Sad to leave this but it's service related.\nLove the pizza here and live in the area but tonight the Pizza shop employees were very rude & I felt like I was racial profiled when they priced a pie I simply asked to order. It‚Äôs the big pie

author: Juli√°n Sarria
text: "Miserable experience trying to sit down for lunch. My sister had her dog with her and the waitress refused to take our orders while we had the dog and suggested we tie the dog to a fence five feet away from our table. The dog was not in any way excitable and was just chilling. Almost every other place we've eaten at on Washington has been fine and they've even give us a bowl of water for the dog to drink under the table. She refused to take our orders and kept blaming other people saying they had an issue with it and that she couldn't serve us in case someone came to eat who was allergic. When we walked by a few days later there were other dogs with customers and I wonder if maybe it's just one waitress who is the problem. Unfortunately we'll never know as we're never going to try to eat here again."

text: 'Been going to Benny for over 10 years.  We now live 30 mins away and decided to drive down to Hoboken too experience some of the best pizza around.  We got home to find its burned!  Very disappointing.'

text: 'Bennys was a sure treat to me in 1979 while being stationed in Hoboken i recommend it to folks when they visit the area. Benny was very kind to all my shipmates while we were there.'

author: Steven Axelband
text: 'Huge slices and very good. But Full Moon Pizza on Arthur Ave in The Bronx is still the best.'

author: Wanda Olmos
text: "If you're looking for a perfect pizza for midnight snacks
column5: then I highly suggest Benny Tudino's. They have the most delicious pizzas that I have ever eaten in my entire life. I have been a customer here since 2018 and my all-time favorite is their Margarita Pizza. The crust of every pizza is so crispy and have lots of mozzarella cheese. The place has a comfortable atmosphere and the staffs are very accommodating."

author: ARTURO MARTINEZ
text: 'Best pizza place'

author: Mark Kolta
text: "For a place that is suppose to be famous
column5: they must have the worst pizza I have ever tasted. I bought one of there Monday
column6: Tuesday
column8: and the pizza was just tasteless
column10: and cheese was falling right off it! Don't get me started with the wings
column11: breaded and cooked like a it was home made or something it was bad! Plus its being managed by a bunch of Egyptains! they are not only cheap! but also just terrible in the pizza business!\n\nMy recommendation is STAY AWAY FROM THEM
column12: any other pizza joint in Hoboken or Jersey City is better then them!\n\nOh don't forget they are overpriced in my opinion
column13: 5$ for their big slice!!!! !!EW!! for $5 dollars I can get 5 slices across the river!! stay away from them!!!\n\nP.S. they only take cash! take your business elsewhere folks"

text: "HUGE slices. Doughy crust. I don't know if you can ask for thin crust."

author: Stephanie Arroyo
text: "I can't complain first time about the pizza awesome! My waitress was nice and helpful I must say
column5: but a white male working in the kitchen behind the counter he had serious attitude I asked if I can take a picture of the pie because me and my friends weren't from around the area he looked at me speaking under his breath. Second time the door was left open and we were freezing so I asked kindly if they can close the door my waitress said she will take care of it he told her no I will close it when I'm ready (nasty). Then he tells one of the workers pointing at our table he was hot  and he had to close it because we were complaining."
